benchmark_details.name: Complex Bench
benchmark_details.overview: Complex Bench is a benchmark for comprehensively evaluating the ability of large language models (LLMs) to follow complex instructions composed of multiple constraints. It provides a hierarchical taxonomy for complex instructions, including various types of constraints and composition types.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the ability of LLMs to follow complex instructions with multiple constraints effectively.

data.source: Manually collected dataset based on a hierarchical taxonomy of complex instructions.

methodology.calculation: Aggregate scores based on dependency structure determined by different composition types.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better adherence to the constraints set by complex instructions.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation by multiple annotators to ensure clarity and validity of constructed instructions.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC BY 4.0 for dataset, MIT for evaluation code.
